Review: Â The staff memeber whom we checked in with whose name was Khaldoon was brilliant. So helpful, friendly and informative. The room which had been upgraded for us by the hotel was exceptional. We stayed in a one bedroom king suite with the view of the Big Ben, River Thames and London Eye. The view was so beautiful at night. Opted in for a few upgrades as it was my partners birthday so went for prosecco on arrival, and the 'celebration package' which included more prosecco in an ice bucket, balloons which were blown up around lounge area and a hand-made cake. Breakfast each morning was hosted in the hotel restaurant and was a english breakfast buffet-style. The location was so convenient and close to the main attractions such as the Sea Life Centre, London Eye, Big Ben, Houses of Parliament, etc. and not far from the Shard and bars we visited.

Review: Â Because of the Covid 19 unfortunately  we were unable to stay at our original  hotel ,The Park Pkaza River bank as it is not open to guests at the present time so we were moved to Park Pkaza Westminster ,we were also given 20% off food and drinks by the hotel . So this review is for the Park Plaza Westminster . We were not disappointed, we were given a suite with stunning views of the River Thames and the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben . The facilities in the room could not be faulted, it was roomy ,clean and well equipped and although  at the present time the cleaning staff  only  clean every third  day we were left a collection of new toiletries ,drinks each day . The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and made our stay very relaxed . Hotel was local to everything which meant we could walk to were we wanted to visit as didnt want to have to use the Tube in current  climate .

Review:
Â Great location, amazing hotel, clean modern, spacious room, would recommend the river view. You can sit in your room and while away time watching the boats and the London Eye. The bar and executive breakfast lounge has views over the river too. Vauxhall is nearest underground station and is only a few mins walk away - you are in central London in no time. 
Rooms have electric curtains and touch controls for lighting and heating. Coffee maker, tea and hot chocolate and biscuits in the room. Bath and large wet room shower in the room. 
Staff were courteous, polite and helpful. Absolutely great value for money, rooms were quiet, spacious, comfortable and clean - would definitely stay again and will be recommending to family and friends.

Â The property was great. However when we arrived at 3 pm the room was still not ready, check I. Is at 2pm. We waited over an hour to check in, then was told a supervisor needed to check our room. The facilities were great. However they do not mention that if you want to use the pool you have to book a time slot, this very nearly caused a melt down for my Autistic Daughter. Thankfully they let us in. If you need to book, tell us!!
Finally we found the pillows hard and uncomfortable, we left with stiff necks. Not really what I would expect for Â£244 per night. Lovely hotel, great location, great views, disappointing service and comfort.

Review: Â Modern decor in the Executive Room was lovely.  It was well-appointed with all I could need/.want for my trip.  Fine views from the room.  Gym was enough to maintain fitness away from home during a short stay.  Location was excellent.  By far and away, the best thing about Park Plaza is the staff.  Travelled with my elderly mother and the staff took exceptional care of her.  Special mention to Ken who looked after us at breakfast and even looked out for us on the second morning so that he could give my mum the lovely table by the window in his section. That man should get some kind of hospitality award - a consummate professional and just a genuinely nice guy who made my mum feel special.  Also Abdullah - he asked us if we needed a late checkout and arranged the extra hour we asked for whilst we ate breakfast.  Superb care and attention that made my mum's stay very special.

Review:
Â I have stayed here a few times and this was by far the best stay yet!...  Okay to be fair we got a complementary upgrade to Plaza On The River due to a few problems with our last stay at the Park Plaza Riverbank. 
So Plaza On River is another hotel within the same building of the Park Plaza Riverbank and shares most of the same facilities.  The rooms however are more classic with a warmer feeling to them and they obviously focus on BEAUTIFUL river views. 
We had also been granted executive access with complementary food and drink (including alcohol from 6pm-8pm), a lovely peaceful lounge bar with stunning views of Houses Of Parliament, London Eye and many more landmarks. 
All in all we had a fantastic stay and nothing was too much trouble from the lovely reception team and the staff in the Executive Lounge.
Title: Great stay!...  We will be back!

The staff were dismissive and we went in at different times of the day and night. There was never any hot or cold canapÃ©s. When we asked the member of staff he was quite rude. Also I had to pay a Â£100 payment for access to the fridge/mini bar in my room. We didnâ€™t use the mini bar and was advised on checking out, that I would receive a refund in 10 days. The member of staff said you should have been told. If you use a credit card it doesnâ€™t get charged to your account. I paid by debit card. I thought that was extremely poor. Review: Â Part of the Park Plaza chain of hotels, which all have a similar polished feel with door staff at the entrance. I always try to book a Park Plaza hotel if my budget allows and usually you can get a decent price at either the Riverbank, Waterloo or Westminster Bridge. Although out of the three, I prefer Riverbank, since Waterloo backs onto the train line and Westminster can be very busy, especially at check-in. The rooms are nicely appointed, modern and very clean, check in staff are always friendly and they have a decent gym, pool and room service. I haven't had breakfast here and I imagine it's similar to the other Park Plaza hotels nearby which usually have a good selection of choices. It's also a nice walk along the Thames to my office near Blackfriars which takes about 25mins and also really close to HoP, Westminster Abbey, London Eye etc... all within 20min walk away if you're sight seeing. I definitely recommend.

Title: Brilliant

Review: Â From check-in to check-out, we were greeted by friendly staff that helped with all our requests. The hotel seemed very new; it was clean and the room was really comfortable with a big bed, soft chairs and plenty of space. The bathroom, especially the shower, was great and for once the bathrobes were soft - often they are rough and corse so this was a nice surprise. There was also a Nespresso coffee machine which was a massive upgrade from the usual complementary packets of coffee and milk you typically find. The room 'control panel' took a bit of getting used to but once you played around, you could automatically open the curtains and switch between different lighting settings. Overall, it was a lovely experience and we will definitely be returning!

Review:
Â This hotel looked brand new, and the bus boy told us it had been recently renvovated.  The style is modern and shiny and reminded me of Vegas. Lots of shiny stone and surfaces. 
Bed was supremely comfortable and room was spacious. it was a nice surprise to see it was a "smart" room, controls by the bed.  It was nice to control the curtains from the bed. 
The hotel is very close to the London Eye, and once you figure out the buses, it's very convenient. There is a stop at the front door which ferries you to Waterloo Station.  
Hotel was always very clean, and we got a free bottle of water and a bottle of wine, plus a little tray of macarons and chocolate upon check in.  Very nice gesture indeed.  I would definitely recommend it.

Â The hotel is situated very close to the Thames. It has great views of Westminster especially from the dining area/bar. It's a few minutes walk to all the hustle and bustle but situated far enough away from the noise and chaos which for us was perfect.
The room was very clean and comfortable. The control panels on both sides of the bed were an unexpected bonus. They controlled lights, air con and curtains ðŸ˜ as well as a few other things. The hotel provided dressing gowns and slippers and tea and coffee making facilities. The breakfast was great. Buffet style with plenty of choice and very tasty. The staff were polite and helpful and the communal areas of the hotel were always clean and tidy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend the weekend in london. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Review:
Â This was the second time I've stayed here,I booked it months ago and paid a lot of money for a suite as high as possible and a river view!
I ended getting a river view in the lounge area of my suite but not the bedroom area which is the main point of our visit, also I paid to have breakfast in the executive lounge and each day I went for breakfast they tried to tell me I was in the wrong place and should be on the 1st floor,even after ai explained I had payed for the privilege!!!
They then humiliated me in front of other guests making me wait there until they had confirmed this with reception as if I was telling lies!!!!!
I have booked a return visit for two nights at the end of March and will be expecting a better room and better treatment. I have booked to stay in the plaza on the river and look forward to your reply.
Regards
Jason Hazelton

Review: Â the heating was not working and no one would answer the phone to correct it. it was also very cold that night, the manager finally came and he could not fix it, i have him on video confirming he could not fix it and would refund the room but has done done a refund, now i have the head ache of chasing the hotel for a refund!!
Title: terrible experience, i would not advise anyone to stay here

Review:
Â Not much.
We changed rooms 3 times as the first 2 were in the middle of a renovation and there were tools on the floor in the corridor and the whole etage smelt of paint.
The second 2 rooms on the 8th floor, one had water drippjng through the ceiling and smelt of smoke, in the other there was something wrong with the air conditioning and the room was like a sauna. We complained to the manager who was very nice and actually upgraded us, but it was still very time consuming.
The drinks in the bar were exorbitant, 11 pounds for a small aperol spritz, no crisps or nuts either. You couldn't get a coffee in the bar before 11 oclock if you were not having breakfast which was both ridiculous and very annoying as because  the hotel isn't very central we had to walk for about 30 minutes to find somewhere.
Then to top it all on the second night of our stay the fire alarm went off at 22.45, which was extreemly frightening as we were on the 14th floor.When we arrived outside in bare feet and dressinggowns we were told by a guy smoking outside the hotel that it was a false alarm...... no one from reception apologised or gave us any explanation which we found atrocious, we returned to our rooms rather worried and as you can imagine we didn't sleep very well.
We were all really disappointed with lots of things, the reception gave us no information of where anything was when we checked in, so I think they definitely need some training in customer relations.
Most of the staff didn't acknowlege you in the corridors which isn't very  good either.
All 4 of us have stayed in lots of london hotels booked through you and have never had such a bad experience, none of us would stay there again.
Title: None of our group would stay there again.

Review: Â Booked a room for my partner and I and requested a cot for my 14 month old baby ahead of booking. This was confirmed. Checked in 2pm and the cot was not in the room. A travel cot was bought in with some old sweets in it. Small problem - it had no mattress! After a debate about child safety and a mattress we left for a few hours. The manager promised to resolve it prior to us coming back and to phone. No phone call! We got back to the room and the travel cot had been lined with towels by head of house keeping! Apparently no mattresses are provided and no one has ever complained before. It took till 7pm to have to move rooms and I had to sleep with the baby in the bed and ensure he did not fall out! They did give us complementary room service but I would have preferred a safe place for my baby to sleep! Cleanliness in rooms was not great either. On a positive note the location is great and the swimming pool! Staff need training as it was like the computer says NO! The hotel is not suitable for young children.

Review: Â Because I had stayed before it was my wifeâ€™s birthday so arrange a treat for all the family so booked 3 rooms a family room for my son and his 2 children. I pre arrange a cot before arrival. But when he arrived to his room there was no cot or any bed made up for his daughter. They also discovered the main bed was broken. Reported this to reception who said they would deal with this and visited the room and said the bed could not be fixed. They changed the room and promised a cot as we had dinner arrangements. When we arrived back to the Hotel around 7.30 as my grandson is only 1 they went back to the room to find there was no cot? My son came back to reception to repot this again they said they would get this sorted. After 20 minutes still no cot had arrived. So I asked at reception as it was past my grandsons bed time. They said they wound speak with housekeeping. I did comment that this was the third time we had asked about a cot also it had been pre arranged. They said they would get straight onto it. It took in all over a hour which I found was unacceptable and spoilt the weekend and the surprise birthday with no apologies.

Review:
Â Park Plaza is a very comfortable and well located hotel to stay in.This was my 4th stay. Their room service staff is polite, professional and very efficient BUT, the Housekeeping Department is not at all at par with the rest of the hotel. I had to ask the people concerned in the lobby EVERYDAY to make sure my room was cleaned as it wasn't done on the 2nd day. Moreover even though I requested a change of sheets on my 4th day, all they did was change 2 of the pillow covers and duvet cover. The bed sheet, which needs to be changed more often was not!!
I stayed there for 6 days but my bedsheet wasn't changed! Even after speaking to people at the desk.
It was futile calling housekeeping and get into an arguement with someone there (and I spoke to them quite a few times to ask again and again for face towels and for laundry etc), as almost everyone I spoke to in Housekeeping didn't seem to understand English or in fact even spoke it clearly. Park Plaza really needs to improve their Housekeeping services.

All in all, I have no real reason to complain.

Title: We had a fantastic stay

Review:
Â We should have been able to book into our two rooms from 2pm. This was an 80th birthday present for my Dad. We arrived at 3.30pm to a long queue and were then causally informed the room with a river view wouldnâ€™t be ready for a â€˜long timeâ€™ due to previous guests leaving late. We were told to come back in an hour which is completely unacceptable. Came back after about 40 mins and complained to another receptionist who unfortunately didnâ€™t appear to have a full grasp of English - we seemed to be at cross purposes. I emphasised that there wasnâ€™t going to be a lot of point in booking a room with a view if it was dark by the time we got it, but she just kept reassuring me we would get a room with a view! I offered to clean the room myself as I really wanted my Dad to see the view in daylight. Eventually Mark came to the rescue. He took charge of the situation, and discovered the room we were supposed to have hadnâ€™t even begun to be cleaned. He then moved heaven and earth to get us transferred to the sister half of the hotel and upgraded us to a much better suite and view of the river with the Houses of Parliament. He definitely saved the day and for us the reputation of the hotel. But it had taken an hour and 40 minutes for us to get my Dad into his room, so we werenâ€™t able to fit in a pre-theatre meal.
The only other downsides were no one answered the phone when I had a query late at night - and the next morning the phone kept ringing but there was no one there when I answered it. You have to get all the information about breakfast times/location and the pool from the TV channel - a paper guide would be good, especially for older guests. Breakfast was great for us but by the time we left at 9.10am there was a massive queue - so best to go early.

Â Signage around the reception area could be improved as there was no obvious sign for check-in and check-out and there was always a que of people waiting to sign -in with no members of staff available at check-out.
The room was NOT available on our arrival and had to wait approx. 2 hrs, although we were offered a complimentary drink at the bar while we waited.
We asked to extend our check out time to make our homeward journey arrangements easier and although this was catered for we were only given 1 hour complimentary and had to pay for a further 1 hour ourselves, considering our room was delayed on arrival I feel this could have been waivered.
The staff at the bar/dining room could give better communication as to the protocol to follow while in the dining room and bar seating area.
Overall communication was poor, We had to ask questions rather than being explained to by staff on our arrival of certain aspects of the hotel.

I was told there was a sofabed in there but someone would come up shortly to make it. When we got to our room there was no sofabed. We called the guest services who were unsure of what we wanted. I went down from the 16th floor and spoke to reception. She questioned ms at first as she really thought there was a sofabed in our room. She asked if we had pland and yes we did, it was my birthday. She said to get ready in the room we were in and she would sort another room. Concierge would move our bags later. Before we left the room was ready. When we returned back to the hotel that evening with two very tried children, the sofa bed wasn't even made. We had to call guest servives/reception again to ask someone to do it. In the morning my husband tried to have a shower which nearly flooded the bathroom as the shower tray was blocked.

Review: Â Hotel and facilities were very good.  Attention to detail with regard cleanliness of tables and inparticular flooring around the restaurant seating at breakfast sadly lacking but otherwise very good - I am quite particular.  It really annoys me when there are sugar packets and crumbs on the floor around the table you are being taken to sit at and when tea and coffee is poured but no teaspoons are provided in your initial table lay, so you have to ask for these and the staff have to source these when they should be available and on the table in the first place or automatically provided when your drinks are brought.  We spent 7 nights here and these issues were daily, with no exception.   Standards slipped sadly since our last visit two years ago, but that said I would still return again.  This is still one of the best hotels I have stayed.

Review:
Â Breakfast service poor. Breakfast room was full and was asked to go to a conference room restaurant (with no wondows) whereby still overcrowded and short on plates and breakfast and even had our allocated seats taken due to confusion by staff. 
The fuse in our room went twice because of a faulty hairdryer. I reported it first to cleaning staff, then reception after a 10min wait. After 15min maintenance fixed the fuse but after the second occurrence the receptionist promised a new hairdryer. No hairdryer was brought up. When leaving the hotel I tried to speak to the same receptionist but she asked me to "wait one minute" and then checked-in two seperate customers although she was fully aware of the situation. Instead of waiting further we requested a hairdryer from the concierge. After returning from our evening out there was still no replacement hairdryer. 
Furthermore after meeting the duty manager (Mr Salem) I was promised a loyalty membership would be created in my name with enough points to be able to book one night stay in any hotel own by the brand. This has not happened. The hotel service is so poor and the attitude appears to be that it doesn't matter due to the good location and high turnover of customers. Very disappointing.

We were changed to a room without a view of the river (which we had paid for) but were offered breakfast in the executive lounge for our stay. Throughout out stay however, there was numerous issues which seemed to come down to housekeeping. Hotel staff were happy to help and very polite but no followup from housekeeping was very frustrating. We had to call several times to have any issue resolved. There was a list of things but having our TV not working for the duration for movies (TV stations were working) was annoying and almost the final straw, and whilst staff tried their best to rectify, maintenance and services couldn't get it to work at all and communication between hotel staff and maintenance/outside services was very poor. Another change of room still didn't find the TV working! Concierge was brilliant, very knowledgeable and helpful and I hope the housekeeping services improve as that would have greatly improved our experience.

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Review: Â Food, not enough English food on evening menu, had to go out to find a place to eat. Breakfast was a farce, it was cold and inedible. We helped ourselves from the self service bar, after ordering fried eggs.  We returned to our table and waited and waited for the eggs but they never arrived. After reminding staff at least  3 times, the breakfasts had gone cold, so we are asked if we could have them reheated, the gentleman took them away to reheat, and then after bringing our plates back minus the fried eggs we were told the eggs would be a couple of minutes, so again we waited, guess what no eggs. by this time breakfast was cold again before staff brought our eggs. We couldn't eat the food by now, so did complain to a male member of staff who said he would speak to the manager. We were offered to choose something from the a la Carter menu, which would be free of charge, but there was nothing on this menu that remotely came close to an English breakfast. We cancelled breakfast for Sunday morning as I wasnt prepared to pay another Â£32 for two breakfasts after the farce we encountered on Saturday morning. This was supposed to be a celebration weekend for our golden wedding anniversary, but it was ruined for us. Suffice it to say, we will  never book to stay at your hotel again.

Review:
Â The hop on hop off bus was not what we expected, such as in New Youk, the busses run all day as in LA and other cities. In London the bus stops at 5:00 PM, and we were not told that. If you start at 10:00 in the morning and expect to use the bus until 7:00, find a good restaurant and then take the bus back to your hotel, that is a disappointment. We had to take a cab back to the hotel when the bus stopped in the middle of our route. We wonâ€™t use the hop on again in London. We bought a 2 day pass for $80. The second day was horrible too because there was so much traffic we had to wait an hour for the first bus to arrive. We were disappointed with the hop on hop off  based on our other experiences in other cities.  
However, our hotel experience with Park Plaza was the best.

Review: Â This is the second time I have stayed here for work, and staff attitude really leaves a lot to be desired. Too many incidences to describe but with 2 examples - I had an unexpected knock at my hotel room door close to 10pm at night, and was accused of not paying for my meal, and even though I said I had, was accused again so I turned around, showed the receipt and all they could say was - 'oh- well we need to take a copy of that receipt'. No apology for the accusation. Second example -  staff removed my personal food from the fridge (including unopened packets of food). I phoned and complained. They returned the food after it had been sitting in their staff fridge all day, waiting for someone to eat it! All they could say was ' the housekeeping staff must have though you had checked out' and my response - well, that is a bit odd given my luggage and all personal items were there in the room.

First, as an elderly couple we felt that the allocation of the room could have been given a little more thought at reception and not allocated a room with a baby "Play/Sleep" cot in it which we could not fold up and place out of the way. It took up too much room, particularly as it was not requested at booking. Second, coming to London for a one night stay it would have been nice to have a room with a view. However, as this was a gift from a sister in law who organised an event, we believe it met all other aspects and requirements. Finally, you could make provision for Coffee/Tea availability in the Reception area. Most elderly people (and disabled people) would like a cuppa after travelling and not have to take escalators, lifts etc to quench a thirst.

Review:
Â I paid for a River view room. At midnight (28th-29th Sptember) we had to move rooms because it was freezing cold and the heating did not work, and no heaters were available.
The Reception Manager at night (a lady) told us to wait till she could get a solution. It was nearly 5am and we did not get an answer yet. Poor service. The guy in training (Was it Nahloo? Sorry I don't remember his name), helped us straight away, offered us another a Studio (although it was not river view). He was really helpful and caring. 
We slept just for a couple of hours before going down for breakfast. A couple of hours.
For a 4*/5* hotel, you expect they would take proper care of the guests and not to have them without sleeping till 5am!
It was an important night as we were celebrating Anniversary. It was not as enjoyable as expected, quite disappointed, as I have been another times in this hotel and it was amazing. 
No compensation or apologies offered to us.

Review: Â With the exception of the staff in the bar/restaurant and the cleaning lady, the staff were generally unfriendly, unhelpful and had little sense of customer care. There were a series of problems during my stay - for instance being locked out of my room with all my luggage and possessions in it - with the hotel denying I had ever been in that room and insisting I had been in a different room 5 floors higher. When this was eventually sorted out, there was no apology nor any explanation given. Until the point they found I was actually telling the truth, it was as though I was making the matter up to inconvenience them. Some serious training in customer care and service is required. Over the weekend, an event in the hotel - possibly a wedding or christening - descended into violence and chaos that spilled over into the lobby and the immediate outdoor surrounds to the hotel. Lots of police appeared, lots of security staff appeared and after a brief period when it all felt a little unsafe, things settled. Again, no acknowledgement or apologies from the hotel management and reception staff.  Frankly, unless you want to be there for its location, I would avoid this hotel until the service offering improves significantly.

Also the bathroom lights automatically shut off after a predetermined time. Twice was in the shower and the bathroom went completely dark. this is pretty disconcerting not to mention dangerous.   I forgot to mention this to front desk .

Review:
Â Working for years in hospitality, regretfully I must say that our trip was not was I would expect from a 4 star hotel.
It was a special occasion and I requested prior check in what I consider a fair and simple request: to leave a note in the bedroom upon arrival and a room with bath. What is my surprise when at check in, there is no notification received even thought the several emails sent (via booking.com and directly to the property). This said, I would like to personally thank Monica (I believe this was her name if I remember correctly), as she was extremely nice and professional, and she reassured that at least we got the room with the bath. Due to the lack of preparation of my two requests (and even though I really appreciated her work, the room was not cleaned upon arrival and there was dust all over the furniture - not a severe case, but I am allergic to dust & thankfully this was more or less solved the morning after). We received later on some macaroons in the room, I believe thanks to Monica too - Italian speaker - great attention to detail.
I must say that we also got a room in a floor where some maintenance work was getting done, therefore we could find dust, paint, and dirtiness all over the hall, and experienced some maintenance noises during early hours of the morning.
The room did not have a proper table for having breakfast (one chair on a working desk and one sofa with a bed table), which is a shame, taking into consideration the wonderful views and the potential guest experience, so it was not really comfortable or nice to use and pay for the room service (plus, I would like to mention that I personally find ridiculous to charge 21 pounds for a breakfast that is consisted in literally 6 pieces of food - it is weird to provide with a full selection of marmalade but no bread or bun or whatever to spread it...).

Review: Â Checking in and out could have been a little more speedy
Title: A great weekend to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday

Review: Â Confusion when you walk into the hotel as there are 2 hotels attached to each other and I didnâ€™t know which side to go.
Title: Exceptional

Review: Â The amenities (tea/ coffee etc..) were a bit cheap (especially as the bar was closed and room service takes a while).
Title: Nice but poor value for money due to the spa/pool, bar/restaurant being closed.

Review:
Â I have booked the room with the view to the city. The first room they gave us was dark one with the view to the OPPOSITE window of the neighbour room in the inner yard! The hotel sells these rooms as a family rooms with the city view! Be careful to book this hotel. You could get ugly view easily! (1,2d photos)Many rooms have terrible view due to the architecture of the building. 
The rooms with the awesome view are located only at the end of the corridor! 
It was really disappointed fact at the beginning of our stay. Then after few minutes of discussion with the receptionist they had changed room for us (3d photo).
Title: Many rooms have terrible view due to the architecture of the building.

Review:
Â Staff were cold, unapologetic and the hotel was dated.... the room was decorated with cold leather and outdated hotel facilities. 
In the river view room there was no English plug sockets by the beds for phone charging and the lighting was extremely dark, even with all the curtains drawn. The Bed was ok... not the standard expecting. 
On arrival we informed the staff that the riverbank has been closed for sometime so they should take it off booking.com. It is incredibly misleading to offer a hotel when itâ€™s closed. Completely unacceptable. 
On check out, the staff let a lady push in front of us even though we had been waiting for 10 minutes patiently. Then on complaint they said â€˜oh you should just put your key in the bowl...â€™ no sign to say to do so...
Â£150 deposit taken for hotel which is in the â€˜terms and conditionsâ€™... this should be sent in a clear communication beforehand. 
Parking a complete mess outside, difficult to negotiate walking around them.
Single use plastics still be used - this hotel is definitely in need of a makeover and better management. 
Lots of people entering the hotel and walking around with no masks.... felt a little uncomfortable at times as to whether the hotel was taking our health and safety seriously.
All in all.... disappointing.
Title: Cold, Dated and misleading.

Review: Â Moved to this hotel, got out in a studio room, told room was bigger but the only thing bigger was that more people could fit in, in the area where our bed was it was smaller than the executive double we booked
Title: Average

Review: Â breakfast not good, spa closed, room in need of renovation.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â I got moved from a superior room to a studio room with no view and it spoiled my partners birthday we could not get in the bar for drinks and the breakfast was tasteless
Title: Very poor

Review:
Â The breakfast was awful, no taste at all the mushrooms had no flavour, bacon was asked to be well done it came undercooked. 
The bedroom didnâ€™t have mood lighting like said on the booking, there was an ugly picture of a gesha doll rather than the usual nice blue mood lighting wall in other park plazas. 
The check in took half an hour as there was an issue with the booking and change of hotel due to coronavirus. Really unimpressed and disappointed by the hotel.
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â Breakfast was loke something from a canteen very noisy and had to queue

Review:
Â There was confetti in room
Still rude staff dust in bathroom
And rubbish view
Title: Fair

Review:
Â I booked the Park Plaza Riverside Hotel, but you informed me that it is not ready given the precautions required because of Covid-19.
I got an upgrade and moved to the Park Plaza Westminster Hotel. However, room did not look like it was deep cleaned and we did not feel safe.
Given then current pandemic issues, the 2 TV remote controls and other utensils were dirty and I was concerned to use them.
In the bathroom, the shower hose popped out of the shower head and flooded the bathroom floor
Overall I think the cleanliness of the room needs to be a lot better give these current conditions.
Title: Review of Park Plaza Westminster

Room_info: One-Bedroom Suite with Kitchenette and Balcony - River View
Review:
Â ****** THIS REVIEW IS FOR PARK PLAZA WESTMINSTER, THE RIVERBANK HOTEL WAS NOT READY SO WE WERE MOVED.******
I paid for a suite and received a glorified hall way that could just about fit a bed in... We were sold this as an upgrade from the room I had booked.
I included breakfast in the booking... On the first day this breakfast was an hour late, cutting into our day. When I called down to see why it was an hour late and where it was the staff member was combative as if we had somehow done something wrong to make the breakfast late.
I instructed her that it would be good manners to apologise rather than try and blame us for their obvious failings and she all of a sudden found her customer service hat again and went and sorted it.
When it arrived it was cold and it got even colder as they sent it up to us without any forks which isn't ideal for tackling scrambled eggs and beans.
When I called down for the forks I mentioned it would be rather cheeky of them for that breakfast to remain on the bill nonetheless it did, they obviously see that as satisfactory service.
This was room 1542, if they offer you this room in the guise of a "suite" do not accept it. It's a very narrow odd shaped room and the only decent thing about it is the terrace and the view which at night is brilliant.
Check in and check out both bang average.... I had no photo id on me at check in and so the guy made a big deal of it and basically tried to make out he was doing me a favour letting me stay there for the Â£450 I was paying for 2 nights.
On check out we weren't even asked how our stay was which is just as well really because I'd probably still be there now.
We were up on the top floor, with the room being so small and narrow we were obviously going to want to enjoy the terrace.... To do this you have to drag yourself down 15 floors again to fill out a form and get a key.... Because naturally they couldn't have mentioned this at check in!!
Title: Underwhelmed is an understatement.

Review: Â Presented with food that I said I had an allergy to.
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â The cleaner must have been in roller skates as she spent very little time client. No refreshes sugar tea etc despite leaving a note!
Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â 1st attempt to access room on 11th floor,  key card did not work
2nd attempt to access room successful, however room not vacant, still occupied!
3rd attempt, different room accessed successfully, however TV turned on OK but would not turn off, volume could not be changed, remote totally kaput.
Informed reception about the TV who assured us that it would be sorted while we spent the afternoon sightseeing.  On returning back up to the 11th floor guess what, TV not fixed! Called reception from the room and told it would be sorted ASAP, 1 hour later back down to reception to complain and were given yet another room.
For a 1 night stay we were given 3 different rooms, this place was like a plate glass Faulty Towers!
Title: Smart hotel, incompetent staff

Review: Â When you speak to the reception staff about an issue you have in your room, you would expect to hear an â€œi am sorry to hear that. Let me see what I can sort outâ€. You donâ€™t expect to hear â€œno, that cant be doneâ€ and then watch them walk away.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â The room was filthy, towels were covered in dirty, the microwave had caked on food, the bed sheets had stains as did all the furniture. The pool was dirty and the steam room smelled terribly and the ceiling of it was peeling off. Very bad standards and maintenance.
Title: I used to stay here many times in years gone by, but standards have dropped tremendously.

Review: Â The air conditioning was not working properly in my room which meant that I couldnâ€™t sleep properly all night due to it being too hot. We had to call reception at 3am and two different people had to come in at two different times to try and open the window. When they were unable to do so a third person had to come in to deliver a fan - which was very loud and constantly making a creaking sound as there was a problem with it. I had to turn this off in the end and manage as best as possible for the next couple of hours. Not ideal when you have paid for a good nightâ€™s sleep and have a work event early the next day!
Title: Sleepless.

Review:
Â Noise from building works, very dirty windows and problems with unlocking mini bar. The walls are so thin you can hear every word from next door. 
Expected better given the price paid and the prosteage of the hotel. When asked if we enjoyed out stay, I replied no. The repection ask why, I replied that I was surprised they asked after the number of times we had spoke to them, they removed the charge of one small drink from the mini bar and said sorry. Well guess that's their opolgises!

Review: Â Our rooms were never properly cleaned. Just making the bed isnâ€™t cleaning the room for three nights. No fresh towels or taking rubbish out of the room. The restaurant on valentines night was a disaster. Food was atrocious . Myself and my partner were given our main courses 15 minutes apart from each other and when we both had our meals on front of us we had to try flag someone down for cutlery. Even though the staff werenâ€™t too experienced they were very polite which is something Iâ€™ll give them. Breakfast no flavour probably wouldnâ€™t return

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review:
Â The cleanliness of the room was awful. They hadn't replenished the mini bar, (half empty wine bottle and half finished bottle of milk remained in the fridge from the previous occupants). The floor hadn't been cleaned as there were crumbs and a grape left on the carpet - even after requesting the room to be tidied again. There were a pair of earphones also left in the children's bed! So begs the question, had the sheets even been changed? 
I had followed this up with reception upon checking out and as yet,  Four days later and I have yet to receive a response from the hotel. 
The bathroom sliding door wasn't operational and the vegetarian options provided for the evening meal and portion sizes in the restaurant was also slightly lacking; my partner left still hungry.
Title: Some staff provided exceptional customer service; expected better levels of cleanliness!

Review: Â The room had no view and looked into other rooms. to get privacy you had to have the curtains drawn the whole time and lights on. It was very gloomy and no natural light. Felt like we were in a box.

Review:
Â Customer Service was very poor. We rang reception (and other numbers) over 10 times to get assistance, no one picked up. Room was not finished. TV did not work. Heating did not work. Cleaners came in whilst we were still in bed. For our troubles the hotel said they would bring us a bottle of wine, we never received it. Breakfast was poor, and the staff are not trained well. All students and talk among themselves. 
I don't usually write reviews, but this was an exceptionally poor experience from start to finish.
Title: Probably the worst hotel we have stayed in for Customer Service.

(Iâ€™m blonde) and not to forget I left my phone charger behind after check out and called up 2 hours later to ask for them to hold on to it as Iâ€™m coming right back to pick it up and guess what charger must of been stolen by a member of staff as the charger was not found and handed in. We paid for a room with a nice view, instead they gave us a cold room with a terrible view of a train track and council estates. My boyfriend and I have stayed at a number of hotels, however with this one we were very disappointed. We will not be staying again or recommending this hotel to anyone.
Title: Fair

Review:
Â The room wasn't what was expected - we were put in a disabled room which didn't have a bath. Something we were hoping for and advertised to us. We asked for another room with a bath but because it was late the hotel was fully booked. Even though the receptionist was trying to get us to pay to upgrade when we checked in.
Food was expensive and not good value for money. I.e. Â£5 for two vegetable gyoza. Or a bottle of house red for Â£34..!
Title: Valentine's weekend

Review:
Â We didn't like the cleanliness of the room when we first walked in.
We didn't like the cleanliness of the bathroom - there were noticeably used bottles of shampoo.
There was a miscommunication with the swimming pool, which was one of the reasons we chose the hotel and paid extra for, both in the evening and the following morning.
The receptionists we had deal with us in the evening and the morning weren't overly welcoming or feeling happy - that said they were the only 2 people we dealt with that made things challenging. Everybody else was joyful and welcoming.
Title: Certainly not the best but it could've been much worse

Review:
Â Iâ€™ve booked for two separate beds.  But they gave me a room with a single bed.  I called them immediately to change  the room, they told me that they would send someone to separate the large bed for two separate beds, that was around 3:30 pm.  I went out after that and I came back at 10:30 pm, but they did not separate the bed, and the air conditioning was not working, which is another problem.  After several attempts to contact them, they sent room service to separate the bed.  After a while, the technician on air conditioning came and after examining, it became clear that there was a malfunction with air conditioning, and the room must be changed.  The room was changed around 12:40 in the morning !!  We were very tired, and although the air conditioning in the room that was replaced by us was not different from the first room, as the air conditioning was making a disturbing sound we had to sleep because of the extreme tirednes. 
For fairness, after complaining and meeting the duty official, he apologized and offered us breakfast as a kind of hospitality.  However, due to extreme exhaustion, we were unable to get up early.  
In general it was a bad experience, and I do not intend to return to this hotel again in the future.
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â Room was filthy! View in room over looked by apartments next door! Maid walked in, in the morning! Breakfast was ok but hash browns were under cooked not good value for money!
Title: Room was filthy

Review: Â The bar are not great, small tables, dirty chair, to many people in one area
Title: Pleasant

Review:
Â Very bad breakfast . 
Long wait to check in .
Staff seemed inexperienced. 
Couldnâ€™t get through to room service .
We got a river view room and it was very noisy from the road  . The window seemed like it was open it was so loud at times . 
When breakfast came to the room it was freezing, no tea or coffee or toast . Had pre paid and told they were understaffed so would be at least an hour, it did come quicker but wasnâ€™t nice at all . We did complain and were refunded for the breakfast but it was a shame . Have had far better breakfasts at other hotels .

Â A lot of small issues which was disappointing due to the cost.

Only one robe but 3 pairs of slippers ??.
We had room service also and some of the food was cold or missing.
Normally we would complain, but this was a recovery trip from surgery and under strict instructions to rest.
Title: Dissappointed

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review: Â In addition to the uncleaned room, the pool is not really a pool for kids/families. Itâ€™s more like a spa pool, and you have to reserve a time to swim and only 6 kids at a time. Not what we were expecting and I wish the website had noted that. We were specifically looking for a pool :-/
Title: Okay

Review: Â Nice hotel but we wasnâ€™t given a great room.  We were given a disabled room, the bathroom floor was soaked after showering as it wasnâ€™t a regular shower, also we were over the railway, not the best view and woken this morning by the trains!
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Very unwelcoming!!  When I arrived they wanted to see photo ID (I'd stayed the week before, wasn't asked for then, I even have their loyalty card) which they then took away and copied (I presume).  I asked why - "It's our policy for all booking.com customers". I also said I wanted a receipt on departure. "We can't give you one because you booked through booking.com". I'd had the same problem last week and in the end emailed booking.com, who emailed Park Plaza, who emailed me a receipt.  What a waste of eveveryone's time!  So I persisted ("It's not our policy") and said I had eventually got one from the previous week ("Well that's not how I've been trained").  The Asst Manager came out.... "It's not our policy, we can't do it because the rate you pay is different from our agreed price with booking.com".  So I showed him last week's invoice - which showed exactly the same amount!  He grudgingly agreed they would provide one on departure (which they did).  Later I went to the bar to get something to eat.  The Maitre d' greeted me and told me to sit anywhere.  The one free table (for 2) was in the window, set for food, so I sat down.  Within 30 seconds he was back telling me I couldn't sit there, that was for the restaurant menu, I'd have to sit at the bar.  So I moved to the bar and he brought me the bar menu.  Then ignored me.  As did the other waiting staff.  I eventually spoke to a passing waitress..... "I'll get one of the bar staff to take your order".  Nothing.  Eventually after nearly half an hour I decided there were more deserving places to spend my money so I went to the burger bar under the railway arches down the road where the service was a million times better than this so-called 4-star hotel.  I stay in hotels on business every week, and I don't think I have ever been made to feel so unwelcome as at the Riverbank Park Plaza.
Title: Very unwelcoming, clearly don't like booking.com guests!

Review: Â Inflexible staff who were not interested in customer service.  I ordered food from an outside vendor and the front of house refused to bring it up or let the delivery guy do it.  I was on a conference call and had to let my food go cold.
Title: Poor

Review:
Â On our first day when we returned to our room the housemaid had left the dirty sheets on our floor. They also left dirty glasses and didnâ€™t replace them. We tried to make a room service order and were trying to get through for 40minutes when someone eventually answered we were asked to call back in 10 minutes they were busy. We called back and placed an order and sat up for over an hour and the food never arrived.
On our second day we returned after being out for the day and our bed was made so poorly, the sheets were also very badly creased. Photos below of what our bed was made like when we returned. (Btw the maid had placed the items on the bed like this.)Remember this is supposed to be a 4 Star Hotel.
Title: Not up to the standard of a 4 star hotel.

Review: Â Nothing
Title: Worst vibes

Review: Â The staff are awful in this hotel. You literally could not make this up. I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights upon moving to London for the first time. I had driven quite a long way and had a lot of luggage. Instead of being helpful the doorman proceeded to sneer and say "you have 30mins". How about a welcome to London!? I then asked him if there was anywhere to tye up my bike and he actually rolled his eyes, laughed, sneered again and said he didnt know. (It was visible from where we were standing). The room was above average, but the cleaner did a rubbish job - removing dirty cups and glassses without replacing them. We went down to restaurant and were served food which was still partially frozen!!! We then had to wait 30mins to pay our bill. Upon going to the spa there were no towels available on 2 x occasions, when I spoke to reception about it, the receptionist made fun of my accent before resolving the problem. Upon checking out of the hotel; the staff made a huge fuss about storing our bags. We actually had to bribe the bellboy in order to get this stored. This is a lovely hotel, in a great location but the staff are beyond a joke.
Title: Fair

Review:
Â The breakfast was not very good 
Quality of food was poor. Eggs were awful. Cheese and ham sat out and was starting to curl up as it was not refrigerated . We paid for breakfast before we booked but eventually ate out as itâ€™s was so poor
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Bed was very hard and pillows were very hard. Very uncomfortable nights sleep.

Broken glass and spilt juice in a drawer from previous occupants and not cleaned. Not enough normal height tables for breakfast, have to sit at low tables and stoop forward.

Review:

Review: Â The breakfast not so good standard breakfast and hot dishes you can order for additional price. I ordered Executive room and asked the room with view. In result we received room with view on wall. I asked to change it, but girl on reception said there is no free rooms. I stayed in this hotel before and had a better view. The room was very shabby. The hotel certainly has problem with maintanance. 2 showers was leaking and 1 absolutely can't be used for washing. The sink was with crack, The mirror with big scratch. The pin on toilet bowl was broken, the trash bin was broken. Also service in restaurant was very low. We were waiting very long our bill and were mixed up the drinks which we ordered.

Review:
Â The AC in our room was broken so the room was uncomfortably hot for the whole stay. The curtains were broken so one didn't close properly. We ordered room service and when our chicken wings arrived they were cooked thoroughly - raw chicken in some cases. When we complained about this, we were told the duty manager would be informed and come back to us - they didn't. 
The spa was beautiful, although we weren't able to use it as the pool area was full of families with kids - less of a spa and more like a community pool which we weren't expecting. 
All in all it just wasn't the standard of stay I was expecting.
Title: Underwhelming

Review:
Â Nearly all of the staff were quite stand offish, especially the ones in reception. It was also the same in the bar Nobody smiled apart from the guy who helped me into the taxi when I was leaving
It doesnt cost anything to greet someone with a smile
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â I am very embittered by the treatment received by the hotel management, I would dare to say total indifference, I mean. Arriving in the night I found a room completely frozen despite having put the air conditioner to the maximum, after half an hour the environment was always very cold. So I went to sleep freezing all night. Besides that I spent a night in white also for the noises of the elevator. The next day I asked to move to another room and unfortunately, returning in the night, I found myself in a suite where the air conditioning worked in the living room but not in the bedroom. The next day, I again reported the matter to the reception asking for a resolutive intervention, in all senses including the dispute of the payment unfortunately anticipated with Booking provider, on the problem suffered, however there was no intervention by the Management to reconcile the unfortunate situation that has arisen. Bad behavior!
Title: Poor

Review: Â Unable or unwilling to provide a VAT receipt, every other hotel where I book through booking.com are able to do this so why not Park Plaza? I will now have great difficulty reclaiming the cost from my company.
Title: Won't provide a receipt!

Review:
Â Worst handing of a booking ever. wouldn't help me move the date, kept saying only booking.com could move it. when i spoke to booking.com they said they were happy to move it but couldnt get an answer by phone from the hotel. they asked me to asked the hotel to call them. i rang the hotel back but they refused to call booking.com as its not their policy? they also said booking.com shouldn't be calling them its done by email. i rang booking.com back and they said they cant do anything without the hotels permission. i rang the hotel again and they said they cant do anything without booking.coms permission and i wold be charged for a stay i never had. shocking behaviour on both parts. will never use either again.
i have owned many hotels and used booking.com at all my sites and i do what i want, booking.com would never stop me making amendments or date changes.
Title: poor service from both the hotel and booking.com. wouldn't use either ever again.

Review:
Â Shower didnâ€™t work, the valve came off completely and just spurted uncontrolled water so I squatted in the bath.  
Hairdryer didnâ€™t function. Also asked if I could get a shaving kit using the reception phone but nothing was followed up on. Items in the room bar were astronomical Â£4 for a small jar of peanuts!
Staff werenâ€™t to keen on me sitting alone in the restaurant by the window overlooking the Thames and wanted to move me to a bar high stool to eat from the bar menu.  Irritating and nonsensical (though I guess a couple or family would have tipped higher)  so I left and went to a local supermarket for a take away sandwich, beer and a razor. Glad it was just a one night business trip.
Title: Nice modern hotel. Good staff. Poor attention to detail.

Review: Â Very noisy air conditioning that sounded like it had paper stuck in it

Review: Â Too noisy at night. Sounded like machinery was running intermittently all through my stay. Kept me awake most of the night. Very poor show.

Review: Â When I arrived at 9pm there were no double rooms available. When I complained I was offered a room but when I arrived it was clearly a sofa bed and not a full bed. The room I stayed in was on the 13th floor and the the windows overlooked the hotel air handling vents. This room was very noisy and I had great difficulty sleeping through the constant loud hum of the vents. On checking out I was not offered any compensation for my difficulties.

Title: Poor

Review: Â Often the keys stopped working and we need to call help from reception. On a tiring long day, you may need to wait for someone to help you get in the room.

Review: Â There was a mix up with the booking that led to my teenage daughter being let into someone elseâ€™s room at 11pm at night, instead of just issuing another room, they kept us all waiting at reception for over 30 mins to sort why it had gone wrong despite my explanation that we had to be up at 4am to run an event.  At checkout there was another mix up the following day which made us late.  Staff were not remotely apologetic, despite our booking being over Â£2k total (7 rooms)shocking!
Title: Appalling

Review: Â The bathroom wasnâ€™t very clean it had some clumps of dust and hair that had been left on the floor. Just my preference but I like to see something out of a window rather than a similar building about 15 foot away, there was no chance of booking a preferred room and if necessary paying extra for it. We paid for the superior room to incorporate breakfast for an extra Â£25 as opposed to Â£22.50 each if you paid separately at the hotel, we found the breakfast awful!!! The bacon was congealed together and tasted very strange? There was also some insipid sausage along with some bland scrambled eggs, the hash brown was nice but the beans tasted of an inferior nature to a â€˜standardâ€™ type. There were only plates at the warm buffet so after queueing at the continental section, because the cooked breakfast was inedible, we had to go round again after fetching a plate because they didnâ€™t have any there. We had to wait for ten minutes for one of the rare waiters to fetch a small jug to put milk in for our tea and coffee, when we did get some the coffee was like sludge and not very nice so went for the machine version and dutifully queued with 6 other guests for one o the machines whilst a similar number queued for the other machine, getting down the last two we were then told the machine had stopped working so had to join the back of the other queue!!! I decided to have a latte and a cappuccino but upon returning couldnâ€™t taste any difference between the two as they were both really poor. My advice would be to not bother with breakfast as it was really bust and definitely not worth the wait, go out and find somewhere else. My last moan is we were unceremoniously woken at 03:45 in the morning by someone trying to get into the room opposite by tapping, banging, slapping and shouting to the occupant all to no avail, in the end I had to tell him to go down to reception to get them to attract the attention of whoever he was cohabiting with. I understand this was not the hotels fault
Title: Sister hotel on Westminster Bridge is much better

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review:
Â We were checked in to a room 1547 at 2pm and took our bags up to that room where there was no bed made up for our little boy even though it was meant to be a family room for three! We had tickets for the London eye so I thought Iâ€™d sort that out later when we got back! We then went out to explore London! We returned home after a long day at about 9.30pm and I checked with reception to see if the bed had been made! They said go up to your room and we will send housekeeping up with the bedding! We went up to room 1547 to find our keys didnâ€™t work so rather than lug my 8 year old back downstairs my husband went down to tell reception! In the meantime housekeeping came to make up the bed! He used his key to get into room 1547 to find a man come to the door in his pants who said our luggage had been taken back down to concierge and this was now his room and his children were asleep! He said to me â€œyou had Disney cases, they were taken back to concierge!â€ Julian the housekeeping manager heard all this and then took us back down to reception where another concierge man found our bags and said the guest in our room didnâ€™t see our bags but he clearly had cos the guest told me I had Disney bags so heâ€™d seen them! And we had valuables in the bags which if he wasnâ€™t an honest person he could have taken our belongings including an iPad! 
We were now in reception with a very tired 8 year old with no room! The receptionist gave us a new room 1641 which we went all the way up to to find no bed for my little boy just a double bed and a table! This room was a smaller room than 1547 and no room to fit a bed! We rang down to reception to tell them and they kept saying we will send the bedding up! There was no bed to put the bedding on! Julian then arrived with said bedding and said he had no beds to fit in that room but he could squeeze a camp bed in! I went back down to reception to see if there was another room but they said they were fully booked!

ON CHECKOUT ANOTHER MEMBER OF STAFF WAS EXTREMELY RUDE AND SENT US TO 2ND RECEPTION WHEN WE HAD STAYED AT "PLAZA BY THE RIVER" SAME AS WAHJIT HAD DONE. FUNNY HOW THEY LOOKED AT US AND SEGREGATED. MAKES YOU WONDER IF RACE HAD SOMETHING TO DO WITH IT AS OUR FRIENDS IN THE SAME GROUP WERE TREATED DIFFERENT AND YET I BOOKED ALL ROOMS.
WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE AND ALSO HUMILIATED. THIS SHOULD NOT BE 4 STAR DEFINIETELY MINUS -3 STAR. SERIOUSLY THE STAFF NEED TRAINING OR BETTER JUST REPLACE THEM ALL WITH ONES WHO CAN ACCOMODATED GUESTS FROM EVERY RACE AND ETHNIC BACKGROUND. REALLY EXPENSIVE FOR NOTHING JUST THE OUTER BUILDING WAS THE NICE THING ABOUT THIS PARK PLAZA.
Title: WORST SERVICE AND THE MOST INCOMPETENT MEMBERS OF STAFF I HAVE EVER WITNESSED. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed

Â We booked a family room. The room was tiny - when the sofa bed was out there was literally no room for anything else. Much worse, It took until nearly 10pm to get sheets and pillows for the sofa bed so our very tired children could go to sleep. A a result we all got a bad nights sleep.
Also, there are not enough lifts. It took 20 mins to get from the 14th to the ground on one occasion.

Review: Â the views of westminster are terrific.

Review:
Â terrible breakfast - stone cold food, over-crowded dining room, no service, tables not clean.
Mold in shower cubicle, curtain hanging down, carpet not clean
Title: Would not stay here again. For the price I expect much better - overall poor.

Review: Â When we arrived at 2.20pm our room wasnâ€™t ready despite it says that entry is from 2pm! The receptionist asked us to come back at 3pm as the housekeeping was still cleaning our room. When we got in the room the cleanliness was very doubtful. There was a chewing gum left in the bath on the soap disposal there was black hair left on the puff and I found hair in the fridge. As you can image my first and last time at that hotel
Title: Okay

Review: Â Room cleaning service was exceptionally late on the first day and on my second day the room was not serviced at all despite the room being vacant all day. When I reported it to the manager at 11.30pm he was completely uninterested and unhelpful.
Title: Very disappointed! Will definitely not be back.

Review: Â Housekeeping and reception staff were useless, room wasnâ€™t cleaned for the duration of our stay, we had to collect towels at 12.15am because our room still hadnâ€™t been made up since we left at 3pm in the afternoon. Very disappointed with the service for the amount we paid for it.
Title: Wouldnâ€™t stay again

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review:
Â Our check-in process was terrible.  We were given the wrong room, twice!  I had to return to reception two times until we finally got the room we paid for (1 bed with pull-out sofa couch).  After the 45 minute ordeal, the front staff were fairly nonchalant about the run-around.  They gave a half-hearted apology, but by then I was over the whole situation.  It was an overall very weird experience. I've never been treated so poorly at a hotel at check-in.  
Also, we ordered room service, and surprise, they got my order wrong.  And lastly, as we stored the sofa bed, there was trash, to include an actual chicken bone from someone's dinner, under the couch.
Title: Based on the terrible check-in process, attitude of some of the staff, I would not stay here again.

Review: Â There was mold in the shower on the ceiling and all along the grout. The hotel overcharged my credit card after checkout, attempted to correct by charging me again for a higher amount. I am yet to receive a response from the hotel. Not happy!
Title: Fair

Review: Â Bad customer service. I also informed them in advance that I booked for our first marriage anniversary but they did nothing for this.

the towels weren't changed  - taken more than 1h to receive them
Only 2 elevators for 500 rooms (more than 10min on mornings)
Very poor experience at the check-out.
at less 10 min from the closest tube
Title: Fair

Review: Â We had made a block booking of three months ahead for a group of 10 to get a good rate at the hotel charged several of my friends the full rack rate for that day
Title: Hotel refused to honour booked rate

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review: Â The cleaning is far away from the desired. The windows cannot be opened and there is no fresh air. We were offered with a room which view is entirely the faÃ§ade of the neighbouring building (at appr. 3 m distance). The sink was clogged and they didn't do anything even after our complain.
Title: Good location but I will never use this hotel.

Review: Â The drinking water and coffee capsules gave only the first day ????
Title: Poor

Title: Pleasant

Review:
Â After a very long flight we just needed a cup of tea, shower and bed.we werenâ€™t told about the kick on the fridge and needing a bond on it to unlock it. When we went down to pay it it took them another 4 hours to unlock it and then found we had no milk and all that was in fridge was 1 can of red bull, 1bottle Diet Coke and a tube of chocolates. There was also no soap in the bathroom. After the servicing the next day we found the cleaner had left no teaspoons. 
The shower didnâ€™t look as if it had been scrubbed
Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â The staff in the bar were awful, asking me to move to a side table by the wall, just because I wasn't eating brunch, despite there only beign 4 other people in the entire room who weren't working there. I found their "European" attitude really bad towards the English guests.  Especially as we are in London not bloody Europe.  they happily stood around  chatting to themselves rather than look up from there phones.The room service was bad, I had to send back a COLD burger and fries and the general disdain was really unacceptable.
As  a frequent guest of the Plaza chain, I will think twice about staying at any of them locations again
Title: Bad stay at the Plaza on the Riverbank

Review: Â Problem with the bill as room price changes everyday according to hotel occupancy, never saw that before London but a nasty bill instead of planned booking price. Breakfast not so great quality wise, a lot to choose from but chemical juice instead of fresh, limited fruit choice, average quality for croissants and cakes
Title: Good service and location, friendly staff but poor quality price ratio (London is an expensive city)

Review: Â The room was not good & the restaurant is â€œa little bit of food on a big plateâ€ & too upmarket!
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â One doorman was extremely rude saying it was our fault a door handle fell on my partner when we tried to open it. Said we should have used the disabled button.
Title: Was only one night but enjoyed our stay

Review: Â There is no doors in the toilet and there is no window you can open in the room so the room smell and you can do nothing about it. The room was not clean.
Title: Okay

Review:
Â I will never return to this hotel the bar manager is a racist. I went with my son to have a drink in the 1st floor bar
the manager didn't let us to sit on the table we wanted by the window his reason was that this section is closed
and wehen we said very calmly that this doesn't make sence he said that he refuses to serve us because we 
questioned him. As the guest of the hotel we were refused to be serve only because we have a middle eastern
look and we were not wearing a tie. Shame.
Title: terrible

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review:
Â Original room had sewage smell and a terrible view, the 2nd room was better but again not a great view
It was a mixed bagged with the staff, the Manager on the day was great and resolved our room issue satisfactorily. As were the were the staff at the pool. The rest however were very surly and not welcoming at all, especially the bartenders in the Chinco bar, it was a chore to order a drink from them to a point where they were close to being described as hostile. 
The room views were not great from either room as i specifically requested a river view many weeks back.
The cleanliness also could of been better, from the sewage smell of the original room to the dirty pool side and changing room areas.
Title: Great spot and potential, marred by smalls niggles which you don't expect from a Park Plaza

Review: Â Room and location great breakfast was a joke 20minute queue and then sat on the lap of the table next to us. Too close and too many people trying to eat in too small a restaurant.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Cleanliness was poor - sadly moved from first room as not clean , then second room equally poor - was given access to executive lounge as apology but that was fairly poor too (though spectacular views) stairwell was also unclean - rotten food etc had obviously been there a while - if residents have access to stairwell (for those who donâ€™t use the lift ) then maybe cleaning it would be prudent
Title: Disappointing

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Review: Â Oh, where to start? We arrived at 2pm, but the room wasn't ready. However, we were offered a voucher for the hotel bar. When we came back from our schedule for that day at 11pm and got to the room, it clearly wasn't vacuumed. We told staff directly then and again after breakfast the next morning, but in the afternoon, the same dirt (there was a red heart-shaped sequin) had only been moved around in the room. Also, they had removed our used towels but only replaced one of them. Beauty products weren't stocked up, used water glasses weren't replaced. The elevators are a disaster, there are only two of them and it takes ages for them to arrive and then again ages to get to the desired floor. Breakfast is to be taken in the bar at very low tables, and the range and quality is the poorest I have encountered so far. There was a bowl with grapefruit segments which were hardly recognisable as grapefruit, it was only a gooey mass. The air-conditioning in the room blows down straight onto the face, so we had to have it switched off at night. You can hear a lot of noise from the street although we were high up and it should be soundproof.
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â Only one robe provided for a room of two. Air con not great. Bit too far out of central attractions
Title: Fine - a lot of money for the location

Review: Â It took over 30 mins to check in. We were then moved to another building and told it was an "Upgrade". As a frequent traveller this was not tbe case. If they would have taken to time to view my profile it would have been clear I have stayed a number of times at the hotel.
Title: Okay

Review: Â The staff at reception and concierge desks seem to have serious difficulty understanding simple instructions in plain English. I ordered a car transfer through the hotel for Heathrow Airport on my final day and when I asked the front desk if my car was outside at the allotted time your employee checked outside and told me that it was not. He then rang the car company who told him that the car was in fact waiting outside the hotel. The driver of said car then came to the front desk and reminded your employee that only 15 minutes beforehand he had approached him and made his presence known! How could your employee have forgotten this in such a short space of time.
Title: WAY over-priced for the quality of service provided

Review: Â Overall Service was poor and not very welcoming
Title: Good location but would not choose to stay here again

Review: Â The view of a train track !! At no point do they tell you when booking that you have to pay an extra Â£70 when there to get the themes view ! And receptionist was rude when I questioned this !
Title: Not all itâ€™s cracked up to be !!

Review: Â TV with Program and Channels guide is quite a bit confusing and not user friendly. I still can't work out the usefulness of the keyboard which is placed on the table in front of the TV. Could do with a wider  choice of TV Stations. The whole furnishing and decorating theme is quite dark and black. I much prefer lighter colors as these are more relaxing and help for a more comfortable stay. Reception staff are not always friendly and receptive.
Title: Met my purpose. Very ideal location.

Review: Â To far away from the city and the bar staff need to get a personality had one drink and left, they were more welcoming than a dose of the plague.and no lager on tap as the gas had gone. At breakfast it was organised chaos...I wouldn't even pay Â£50 per night to stay there, much better and friendlier hotels closer to the city with the same price, bit sad really.
Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â The staff were rude when they werenâ€™t ignoring you. They didnâ€™t properly clean the room and left dirty cups lying uncleaned. Why we were targeted like that is beyond me and particularly annoying given the two times we attempted to use the bar, we were completely ignored and just left without being served. Just overall a really bad experience and I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel
Unless you didnâ€™t care about room hygiene and looked like you had money.

Bad service
