Review:
Â - I thought the location would be great but it was very Far from the underground (subway) 
- I barely could sleep at night, I could hear noises from other rooms.
- The hotel is located next to a train station and my room was next to the railway and I could barely sleep because of the noise of the train.
- I couldnâ€™t use the tv , we asked the receptionist and one of the staff told us to pay a deposit of 400 Pounds ! Which was ridiculous!
- During our check in we didnâ€™t get any proper information about the hotel , for example I wanted to use the swimming pool on my last day which is free btw. I went to the pool and one of the staff members told us that we have to make a reservation for the swimming pool. 
- the staff was not very friendly looking, I didnâ€™t even feel welcomed .I have stayed in many Park Plaza hotels before but this one was the worst!
Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â Had to change (shorten) length of stayy for all three bookings over last three weeks
1. Seemed to result in an unecessarily protracted check in process (even though I had e-mailed and said what was happening in advance)
2. Inabilioty to reduce fees is frustrating but accepted that was clear upfronnt
Title: no problems

Review:
Â Evening meal on first night taken in room - food was cold on arrival 
Room cramped - with no view
Ran out of toilet roll - rang housekeeping to get another roll sent to the room- after 30mins still no toilet roll- had to go to reception to physically get one
Swimming pool- runs on a booking system - you have to book a slot - understandably due to size of pool - HOWEVER this is NOT mentioned on the hotel information online - the only reason we booked the hotel was so our son could use it during our stay
Evening meal on second night taken in the hotel restaurant- food was acceptable despite our order being wrongly delivered- the staff were rubbish- taking plates away whilst people still eating, taking drinks away while liquid still in them, general attitude was very poor
We would not recommend this hotel - there are much better ones for the same price or probably less
Title: In London for the marathon- needed a relaxing stay - most definitely did not get one

Review:
Â Tv reception was very poor
Ice machine on the floor was not working
The lady who checked us in could have been more friendly and helpful
Title: Fine

Review:
Â really disappointed; stayed here before and really rated it.
executive lounge not good-breakfast or lack of it in executive lounge was not explained to us.
went to the breakfast hall cost Â£50 for 2 not worth it.we complained but staff were pleasant but unhelpful.
Title: wont be staying here again

Review: Â Horrible plumbing problems
Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â Expected river view in the room- was told at reception Â£100 per night.. 
some room decor was a little tired and gruby.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Overall trip was a disaster. Check in process was ok, however we were pointed towards the wrong set of elevators. We spent a good 3 mins trying to find the room. During this time we asked for directions to our room from the housekeeping personnel that were around. The first 2 spoke zero english, she kept talking to us in spanish i believe. Finally a male member of staff was able to assist, pointing us in the right direction. Upon entering our room, we noticed that bathroom had not been cleaned. Towels & toiletries were changed , however there were multiple stains on the floor and the wall just by the toilet (looked like piss). The carpet was not hoovered (bits of food) and the hard floor had foot prints and dirty marks. We called reception and was told someone would come up. The lady who came up told us that the ?pee (stains) could not be cleaned, she did not acknowledge the dirty carpet & hard floor despite us pointing it out, she was incredibly rude and not at all professional. We went downstairs to complain, only to be told that house keeping would clean the room in an hour or 2. We asked for a room change which fortunately they agreed to. Suffice to say it was evident that the cleanliness and attention to detail was incredibly lacking for this hotel coz the 2nd room was clearly not well cleaned either (although the bathroom was better, no pee stains). Day 2 of our stay, we woke up to a cold room with the ac blowing cold air despite being set at the max of 28C. I rang reception and an engineer came up. He fiddled with the ac for about 30mins following which he said if it doesnt get warm in 10mins then it would be a "big job". Reception rang after to check if the issue had been resolved and after a long chat it was decided that we would be given a heater. 2 hrs later, housekeeping brought us a kettleðŸ˜£! By this point we had given up all hope of a nice weekend getaway.
Title: Poor

Review: Â Room was very tired and looked like it needed a deep clean. Toilet roll holder was hanging off the wall in the bathroom and the TV reception was poor and kept freezing. Breakfast was good and so was the room service food, however would not stay again @ Â£200 per night.
Title: Fair

Review: Â Room wasnâ€™t made up for the kids bed when we arrived, had to call several times to get this arranged and robes etc delivered. Room was cold, air con didnâ€™t seem to work properly and workers were hanging out of the wall under the desk.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â The room was sloppy. Not clean at all. Not what you would expect from such an expensive hotel.
Title: Ok. Not fantastic.

Review: Â The staff were very unhelpful
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Have a lot of problems with parking lot
Title: The hotel doesnâ€™t have a park space, so customers have to walk faraway to train or use car valley.

Review: Â Perfunctory staff at reception. I was repeatedly hung up on, with no-one calling me back, when I tried to call and arrange something nice for my girlfriend. When I got to the hotel, they told me that they had already organised a room with a view, and a special welcome for us. The "view" was a grey block of flats next to us, with no view of the city/river, and there were 4 tiny macaroons for us as a "special welcome". Further to this, the shower felt more like I was getting peed on, and worst of all, a cleaner knocked on our door at 8:30am, 9:30am and 10:30am, while we were either sleeping, showering or dressing up. Won't be coming back
Title: Won't be coming back, I've stayed in hotels Â£100 cheaper that were better.

Review: Â I didn't like the door handle falling off the bathroom door and that I had to report it three days in a row to have it fixed.  I didn't like the bar fridge in the room being locked twice even though I had paid a 250 Pound deposit and that I tried to sign for a dinner in the restaurant only to be told that I had no credit, the waiter then went to the Front Desk and returned telling me that he was told I had no credit.  I paid by card, went down to the desk and made the Staff check and they said I did have credit, very embarrassing for me.   Our room was often not fully cleaned in that the glasses and the tea/coffee cups that we had used had not been changed when we returned to our room that evening.  We were given access to the Executive Lounge because of the above and was told that drinks, beer etc were free, when I went there I was charged.
Title: I asked the Staff if they had watched Basil in the sitcom Faulty Towers? A dissappointing stay.

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review: Â Staff wasn't very helpful, we couldn't see much professionalism and they weren't too helpful...would not recommend or go back as I travel a lot and stay in hotels but definitely not this one.
Title: Very Poor

Review: Â The staff is not competent, unfriendly unhelpful and outride ridiculous. I was staying at Park Plaza several times but this was the last time. I booked 3 Rooms for myself and Consultants what are working for me. I wanted to extend 1 night for a consultant and was told if I book and pay 2 nights he can have 1 more night or otherwise try your luck on the internet. Never again, At the Restaurant the starter came after the Main meal, at the Bar we where told at Midnight we close but at 23:30 got told want to go early if we could finish. Never again and I will make sure I talk about it.
Title: NEVER AGAIN

Review: Â The housekeeping was terrible. We stayed four nights. We were asked if we would agree to not have housekeeping if any days as eco friendly thing. In return weâ€™d get a bottle of wine or a voucher. We agreed to two nights out of four.  We never got our sheets cleaned. We knew as my lip bled onto the pillow.  We complained on the third night.  They said theyâ€™d send someone to change the sheets while we were at dinner. They didnâ€™t. They said theyâ€™d have room cleaned the next day. That never happened. We complained again.  So out of the four nights no cleaning was done. We had towels replaced.
Title: Disappointing. Nice hotel. If they sorted the housekeeping it would be so much better.

Review: Â Room was to tiny. I booked executive double room but i was disappointed about room size and it looked different from the pictures
Title: Pleasant

Review:
Â Call reception way to many many time Poor quality towels
No robes 
Two tiny showers gels pots 
No notifications that we had to ask the room to be cleaned 
Then was told house keeping would on there way after 1.5 hours nobody had arrived so called again to be told they are on there way 
We went out for an hour when we return the bed was made no clean sheets no clean towels no clean glasses 
So back on the phone to reception and house keeping
Title: Poor

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Review:
Â Staff didn't knew what they are doing.
Needed to change room at 8-9 P.M, because bed and TV was broken.
Next room prepared for only for 1 person. (4 of us).
Overall we felt treated very poorly.
Title: If you are going to stay with your children, stay away from this hotel. Very bad experience.

Review: Â no hairdryer in the room is not acceptable, also reception staff should focus on customers service not putting bunny hats on  , I have called the receptionin 2 days more than 30 times no answer .
Title: Fair

Review: Â It was not up to standard at that price . Nespresso not refilled so down to decaf by the end.  Camomile tea there first night but not after that . Not enough shower gel shampoo in the rooms. Swimming pool and spa main reason we booked three nights but because it was busy we had to book in advance to go which was impossible and not told that in advance . In the end didnâ€™t get into spa . One morning woman in couch in front of lift complaining loudly about everything and staff member basically agreeing with her ! No newspaper available when I asked . On Sunday. Even for purchase . Staff helpful and informative but over worked
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Never ever left a bad review about a hotel but honestly this has got to be the worst hotel experience I've had. We got to the hotel excited to stay there. At the check in desk we were greeted by a the assistant. Who then typed something into the computer, then disappeared into the back for a good 10 minutes. Came out, checked us in. We proceeded to our room. Put the key in the door and shortly realised that someone else was already in the room. Personal belongings were everywhere. We went back down to the reception, explained what had happened and we were given a new room. The hotel was actually alright but that initial wrong room situation had got our backs up a little bit. So when we checked out, a day later we realised that the hotel had over charged us an extra Â£100. So we then had to go all the way back to the hotel to get a refund. The lady who dealt with us wasn't at all apologetic  or remorseful. Looks great but I'd never stay there again.
Title: Worst customer experience ever!

Review:
Â The non river view suites are set beside train tracks for Waterloo station. If your looking to get some sleep give it a miss.
While there is a swimming pool it is very restrictive with only 12 allowed so you have to prebook your slots.
This information ahead of schedule would have made me choose a different hotel.
Title: Fair

Review:
Â Bad smell from Bathroom!
Tv reception was terrible! not worth watching.
View from window also terrible! all i could see was another hotel wall close to my window.
Overpriced for what i recieved.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â horrible view, no natural light, pretty cold in the room, lousy room service, the garbage was not lifted for 3 days .....
Title: Poor value for the money. "Superior" room means lousiest room :-(. But good location.

Review: Â There is no one to help us bring our luggage in when we arrive. The bathroom door does not close. There is no shower or commode door. control for shower is faulty. We ordered food from room service and they took over an hour to bring up the food. If I did not call, they would have not delivered it. The food came and the rack of lamb to be cooked medium is crispy - way,way... too much over cook, I told them that we have 2 children who are very hungry and they did this to us... We will never come back to any Park Plaza Hotel after this, event hough we had a great time at the Park Plaza Hotel Westminsters the week before.  Disappointed completely. They should not charge us for that room service food. Awefull service.
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â Cleanliness of the bathroom could have been better if I'm not picking ( which I am because if the price of the hotel).  Behind the shower door was a clear black line of dust and hair. Also the door handle was broken.  The usb outlet in the room was faulty and didn't charge my phone or portable charger ( we tried 3 cables) which was a shame as though I didn't have a plug I was told because of the outlets I wouldn't need one.  But as I said this is all not picking and luckily I was off of work for my birthday so a dead phone wasn't so bad for an evening.

Review: Â The room on the 2nd floor is next to the railway, noisy, trains in every minute, you can't open the window (there is no possibility to open), the heater/air conditional was so loud, we had to turn off at night, the sofabed is very uncomfortable. The view: the railway and a stock area, photo attached.
Title: nice hotel, but our room was awful.

Review: Â There were no variety of foods in the breakfast but it was good overall. The location a little far from the shops. There were inly two elevators and one of them were out of service most of the time.

So we gonna worry about finding parking

in the afternoon they knocked thinking I ordered something but quickly understood was an error. The funny one was when at 5.30 the phone rang and the guy said: I have the pillow you requested. Review: Â Lift was open to anyone, no check-in with customer card needed. Noise and sometimes crowded lobby due to the bar and restaurant oh the hotel. The location of the hotel is not very convenient since it was hard difficult to find restaurants or coffee nearby.

Review: Â The television seemed to have audio description on some channels which you couldn't turn off. The A/C could only be hot or cold, there was no warm setting. The beds were uncomfortable, including pillows. The mini bar although fitted as standard in the room, it wasn't made clear that it's contents were chargeable and therefore after consuming some of the items, upon check out we were surprised with a high charge. The breakfast was cold and the waiters/waitresses were not on point, we were offered tea but never received and our used plates, cups, etc were still left at our table until we left the restaurant.

Review: Â No coffee machine and minibar wouldnt open. Asked reception to rectify they made a note. After returning to room still no coffee machine or mini bar so room changed. Could not get through to reception on phone for whole stay always had to go down (15 floors) Not the best Park Plaza
Title: Not really a premium experience would not use again

Review:
Â This was bought as a Christmas present for my mum and dad. It was also
their 40th wedding anniversary. I gave you special instructions of this
special occasion and they did have a note. I also called the hotel prior
to their stay and they advised something would be complementary. Your
website advised that a small deposit would guarantee the booking. 2 days
after booking, they took the whole amount. I manually updated the
details to my mum and dads name as advised by yourselves. When I called
the hotel they wanted another full payment from myself and this would be
refunded back to me within 5-10 working days. I have an email as proof.
They put them on the 13th floor with a view of the building. I am very
disappointed with the service and the complementary surprise. There was
no hair dryer in the room, which I find very strange, even the most
basic hotels have these facilities. They got the bill at the end of
their stay, which had Â£145.00 added for using the mini bar. They never
took anything from the mini bar. This was a clerical error. For being a
very favourable hotel, there was no bathrobes or slippers either. I have
my husbands mum and dad going this weekend. I'm not looking forward
to their feedback after their stay. I would not recommend this sister
hotel to anyone. Cheaper priced other Park Plaza hotels are much loved
and have everything you require for a memorable special occasion. I
regret totally booking this hotel.
Title: A bad choice of hotel

Review: Â No view from the room
Title: Fair

Review:
Â Very slow and unreliable lifts
Room wasn't ready for over an hour after check-in time, although I was given a free drink (they tried to give me a second when it still wasn't ready but I declined)
Bathroom wasn't entirely clean, probably because they had to rush housekeeping to get it ready, but the bath and shower were a little dirty and the towels weren't fresh
Title: Overall pleasant, perfect for a quick one-night trip

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Review:
Â My partner did upgrade for the suite through phone because it was my birthday as a surprise after I booked in booking but when we arrived there they had no idea about it so it was poor communication and system also my partner paid for VIP reservation service so we can do early check-in and do special treatment for us and good services but unfortunately they didn't let us in early check in and we waited from 10 am till 2:30 pm ! Also the staff were too rude to us and they don't smile at all
the cleanliness was terrible they didn't clean for 3 days the suite ! they cleaned the toilet only but and rest of the suite was a mess and dirty and the bed sheets was the same for the whole stay it was dirty and they didn't changed it too nasty and the cake we ate and the finished bottle and glasses of wine they didn't pick it up for 3 days was there and they didn't clean the living room it was messy and dirty
also they charged us on meals and drinks that we haven't order !! and then they found out that there was someone took our name and orders food on our room number and our name so it's means there was breach of information between staff other wise how come someone random oder food and drinks on our NAME AND ROOM NUMBER how he knew that secret information if it wasn't breach from the system or staff and how come they have poor security that they allowed random person to order food on our name without checking if he was real guest or a thief  !!!! so the security there was terrible
also the second day they stole my adopter I left it in the bed and came back I couldn't find it.we told them and instead of apologizing or giving us a new one and checking with the room service to investigate they were too rude to us and told us to do police report if we want !
Title: it was terrible experience I would never ever come back to this hotel again !

Review: Â The view and first contact with receptionist
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â On arrival we had a stain on a duvet in our room on the 15th floor, so got moved. The room we were moved (also on 15th floor) to had marks all over the walls and floor in the bathroom as if it had never been wiped or cleaned, along with a brown "smear" above the toilet roll holder. The concierge simply advised us to put some water on the shower wall and see if it improved. This caused a bad smell. I tried closing the shower down and it jammed. The next day we were moved to another room, which seemed fine. We later noticed a hole in the bedding, hairs under the pillow, a broken toilet seat and all the pillows were rock hard. Upon pointing this out to the so called Guest relations manager they wrote the issues down, and wrote "NBTD" at the bottom, (nothing better to do).........I returned to reception with another request, only to overhear them slagging us off and insinuating we were "playing them" and "playing games" and "after something"........"he wants something from us" etc etc. I then speak to the management the next day, and specifically asked for the General manager and received fob off, after fob off after fob off. A staff member also described us as "very difficult" right under our noses to other guests, however he did so in French, unluckily for him I speak the language, and when I challenged him he claimed they were speaking about football.........We were told General manager would be available at 3pm, we say we will be back by 3pm to speak to him, when we ask for him, the front of house manager tries to suggest we said 5pm not 3pm......I then go down at 5pm and he isn't available.........We ended up with uncomfortable pillows, a broken toilet seat, and a generally unclean room, and staff that just kept on insulting us quite frankly. I would never, ever return.
Title: Poor

Review: Â Only had a partial river view which disappointed us. Unfortunately a baby was crying for a lot of the night in another room, and we did not sleep very well because of that. We had no hairdryer in the room and phoned reception to acquire one. We were going to have breakfast, but did not want a full English breakfast and would have preferred e.g. just eggs florentine which would have meant an additional cost. Also not a very personal service when you have to queue for your own tea and coffee.We therefore did not stay for breakfast. The lead to the kettle in the room was not very long, which meant we had to put the kettle on the floor to boil it which is not ideal.
Title: Quite good, but could be improved.

Review: Â It was noisy, got mixed information from reception staff. Bed side light didn't work and even after reporting it we had to unscrew the light bulb very night so it would go off. Room was ok but could of been cleaner.
Title: Fair

Review: Â Room incredibly hot even with the air conditioning on and window open - uncomfortable nights sleep.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â I booked through booking.com and on the web site it states that the hotel will take a Â£50 deposit. You in fact took Â£100 which was processed and taken from my account. Why was this done when the bill was already paid and no damages or outstanding items where incurred. We requested an upgrade and was told that it was not available. We heard another member of staff asking someone else if they wanted to upgrade. When I rang the hotel on 26/02/2019 about the Â£100 being taken from my account I was promised a call back. This never happened.
Title: The hotel was ok for what we needed as most of the time we where out and about.

Review: Â I had arrived at the hotel at around 16:30 after a very gruelling almost 14hr long haul flight and all I wanted to do was get some sleep. Even though im a Radisson Gold card holder I had to wait for almost 20 mins to get to the check-in desk at reception only to find that the room, which was supposed to be ready to check-in to at 14:00 was not ready and was informed by the staff I would have to wait for 1 - 2 hours before the room was ready for me. At that point I was so tired that I could barely keep my eyes open and the only thing that was offered to me is the reception staff told me they would keep my luggage for me while I waited. Ive just gotten off a very long flight I was exhausted, where was I supposed to wait, was I expected to sit in a seat in the lobby or aimlessly walk round London exhausted while they prepared my room. Id booked a room with a river view and in the end I ended up having to stay in a lesser priced room with no river view and the bathroom smelled as if it hadn't been cleaned properly. The apology I received, at reception for this was hardy convincing. The following morning I discovered the the reason why the room hadn't been ready, the previous day, when I left my room for work, ensuring the "please clean my room light was illuminated" the cleaning staff where stood in the corridor less than four rooms away gossiping. I arrived back after being away for over three hours and the room hadn't been clean. I was still suffering from jet lag so I just went to my room so I could sleep again. I later phoned reception to ask for some fresh towels, I've now checked out of the room, three days have gone by and im still waiting for those towels. Ive stayed in the hotel numerous times and never had a problem before but I can assure you I will think very strongly about staying there again. I dont know what has happened to the service in the hotel but it has plummeted from scoring a 10, in my eyes, to dow near a 0.
Title: Riverbank Park Plaza really dropped the ball

Review: Â Better prices hotels to stay in for cleanliness and location.

Review: Â Hygiene has got to be improved. Hair in the bathroom and bed; a lot of hair in a swimming pool. Steam room in the spa has got fallen off ceiling paint all other the steam room. The room is extremely small; way too much technology which failed when we tried to open the curtains or switch off the air con. No complementary water on arrival. It just isnâ€™t worth Â£150 a night. Extremely disappointed and will never recommend my friends. Oh, forgot to mention that we had UHT milk which was gone off (8th August 2018), realised it too late when cup of a tea was made with lumps floating around. Even in travelogue you get consistent basic experience without a fault.

Poor arrangements for breakfast meant that some tables were knee high so causing clients to almost bend double while eating, also there was little healthy choice and items which would usually be included ( omelettes, eggs Benedict, kippers) had an additional fee. It was a bit of a scrum too as there was not really adequate space for the number of guests. The room was small with the twin beds pushed together ..cramped feeling and incredibly warm. We asked for the air conditioning to be fixed so that we could cool the room but it quickly reverted to heating only.

Review:
Â Room service
Cleaning was not a priority and on arrival back to the hotel (on the first day of an eight day stay) at 3pm, room had not been cleaned or serviced.
Face washers not replaced at all.
Not enough coffee sachets - had to ask for more (more than once) When requested, not provided 
only 1 cappuccino and 1 hot chocolate sachet supplied. Two guests??
Power plugs not working on bench.  Had to boil jug on ground.  Jug left on ground by room service for 8 day visit.
Air con not working. Reported this on 2 days. While advised that the air con would be looked at by two different staff. No change.
There were scales in bathroom which did not work. Why provide them and not have them working
Front staff while helpful on approach, failed to follow through with requests.
TV reception and channel viewing choice - very poor.
Minimal extra movies available for an excessive charge.
Title: Staff didnâ€™t go out of their way at all- apart from doorman

Review:
Â In the morning me and my partner went to the spa, when we went back to our rooms we found that our card keys were not working so we couldnâ€™t get into the room. As we were in our robes and slippers we decided to call the reception downstairs. wjen I called a lady in the reception answered and put me on hold for 15 minutes despite knowing that we weeenlocked out. She then disconnected the call and I called at least twice after that. In the end my partner had to go downstairs in his robe and slippers and have them sort out the issue. 
I am extremely unsatisfied and would like some sort of compensation for this service.

We ordered 2 platters & extras - definitely not enough to feed 6! Review: Â Room not ready for check in at 2, had to wait an hour - messed up plans a bit as we were only there for 24 hours. Breakfast chaotic, had to sit at the bar. Staff seemed overwhelmed.
Title: We enjoyed it, but could be better for the price.

Review: Â It seemed like we weren't getting paid no attention when we requested a few things, especially from room service! We had to request slippers, a bath robe as we only got given one in room and other little things which resulted in them taking over half an hour each time! We tried to check in around 10-11AM as I stated we would be quite early, I understand this is subject to availability but it just would have been nice as I requested it like a month ago. When we came back around 3PM we checked into our room, however the bathroom door would not shut at all! We were confused as to how the house keeping didn't notice this when cleaning / servicing the room? It must have been noticed as it was stuck and wouldn't even slide half way! Or maybe it was noticed but they just didn't think people would care?! Very awkward if you would go to the toilet with the door wide open if you ask me! We rung up reception about this and stated someone either needs to fix it or we will have to move rooms (as we had plans for the afternoon) we didn't want it to waste our time. 40 Minutes and 4 phone calls later - a maintenance guy finally decided to arrive! After he was unable to fix or shut the door he then had the cheek to say "are you sure it was like this when you arrived" VERY rude! we had literally just checked into the room, went to go toilet and couldn't shut the door! Cannot believe he tried to accuse guests like that!! We then heard him call reception and say " I will be able to fix it but it will take quite a while" So the reception rang us and said they will move us rooms and call us back in a few minutes time - 10 minutes later no call.. so we took matters in our own hands and went out of our way to take our luggage and go down to reception. We then spoke to a manager who stated he will be moving us rooms, he was very professional and finally we felt like someone actually cared!
Title: Quite unsure of this Hotel

Review: Â The booking in and checking out was disorgnaised and despite paying in advance the keep asking to pay for the 2nd night , had to get managers etc , it really took away as I felt stressed , it was suppose to be a relaxing time post a family death

This same gate had woken me and my wife up again around 6am by then I decided to stay awake and check out but would rather had slept further but having being woken up I didn't pursue to complain. I found the lights in the toilet to have constantly been flickering and also the shower couldn't be set to a desired temperature as it was scorching hot all the time.

Review:
Â I made my reservation through Booking.com, when I received the email confirmation which was wrong, I called the hotel to amend. I was told only booking.com could correct the mistake. When I got put through, they supposedly couldnâ€™t get through to the hotel and consequently, I had to pay Â£50 to change my booking.
Be warned, I spent an hour trying to correct their mistake but to no avail, best bit; I just got my UK mobile phone bill and theyâ€™ve charged me Â£30 for the calls... Not once was I told the number was premium rate. 
Overall, a very bad experience and from now on, I will be avoiding Park Plazas, there is plenty of other excellent London hotels which provide a better service with exceptional customer service.

Review:
Â at check-in on Tuesday night 6/11/18 we were assigned room 315 which was next to rooms which were being remodeled, judging from the dust in the hallway and the plastic tape and carpet protection layer.  Besides, the smoke detector in the hallway closest to our room was covered (to keep dust out according to the staff member) however we considered it an unsafe situation.
I went to reception desk and explained the situation and we were assigned room 303 which was larger with a separate sitting area.  Assigning room 315 should not have happened in the first place yet staff was very accommodating.
Lights and curtains operated by means of remote devices placed on the night stand.  At my side of the bed the device did not work at all.
On Wednesday night after the room had been cleaned and we returned to the hotel, we noticed that the carpet near the bed had not been vacuumed at all !

Title: Fair

Review: Â My room was not ready even though it was past the check in time. I was told that I was checked in but there was no indication when a room would be available. I had to go back myself 30 minutes later to see if there was one. After 5 minutes I was given a room, and the (different) member of staff apologised. Upon entering the room, it was not what I paid for. The pictures were totally different to the reality. The room had a sloping ceiling meaning I could not stand up in either corner. There was only one small floor window, and an 'artificial' window next to it which was just a light panel with curtains across. I felt extremely claustrophobic. The bed was ok, however the bathroom was not to the level of cleanliness I expected. The water pressure in the shower was very poor and the 'rain' shower head obviously needed cleaning as water was shooting off in all sorts of directions.
Title: Impressive at first glance, very disappointing in reality

Review:
Â Arrived at 13.45 to check in and the room was not ready for a 2pm check in which was expected, so we had lunch in the restaurant as staff said the room would be ready in 20 mins, staff in resturant were not interested and you have to order at the bar and ask for menus etc. Came back after lunch after 1.5 hours and room was still not ready, staff where blunt and offered a disabled or twin room instead. Finally were given the room we booked after waiting, no apologies or empathy to our wait and room key handed over with no description of what floor etv. Bathroom wasn't clean, shower hadn't been wiped down (Watermarks all over glass shower door and mirror was dusty with marks on).
There was an iPad next to bed that was lit up blue to close curtains and turn on lights, air con etc which seemed a great idea until the blue light did not go off all night, had to put a towel over it to make the room dark as it was a bright blue floresent light. Air con in the room didn't work, as it pumped out hot air, so the room was boiling hot (in November).

Iâ€™m definitely not staying in this hotel again.
